DataElement.preferredName: Bone Marrow Immunophenotype Flow Cytometry Aberrant Clonal Plasma Cell Percent Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation for the percentage of clonal plasma cells in bone marrow aspirate by immunophenotype flow cytometry.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bone Marrow Immunophenotype Flow Cytometry Aberrant Clonal Plasma Cell Population Measurement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes._The characterization of a set of cells according to the antigens expressed._A technique for counting, examining and sorting microscopic particles suspended in a stream of fluid._A population of plasma cells which display atypical morphological features, an abnormal immunophenotypic profile, and molecular genetic characteristics of clonality (monoclonality)._Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

Property.preferredName: Immunophenotype Flow Cytometry Aberrant Clonal Plasma Cell Population Measurement
Property.preferredDefinition: The characterization of a set of cells according to the antigens expressed.:A technique for counting, examining and sorting microscopic particles suspended in a stream of fluid.:A population of plasma cells which display atypical morphological features, an abnormal immunophenotypic profile, and molecular genetic characteristics of clonality (monoclonality).:Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

Concepts.definition: The characterization of a set of cells according to the antigens expressed.
A technique for counting, examining and sorting microscopic particles suspended in a stream of fluid.
A population of plasma cells which display atypical morphological features, an abnormal immunophenotypic profile, and molecular genetic characteristics of clonality (monoclonality).
Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0372441-19C0078 Flow Cytometry qn curation 4.23.19 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: information related to the percentage value for a cell count.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/15/22 jk added "Qualified" RS as part of MCL quarterly content review.
